GE.evidence: Georgian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (GCCI) is member of Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. GCCI is the union of georgian businesses.          https://srcic.org/silk-road-members/
GE.answerer: Answered by Valeri Chechelashvili, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

LV.answerer: Answered by Una Aleksandra Berzina-Cerenkova, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AM.evidence:
"Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Republic of Armenia (CCI of RA) is member of silk road http://www.srcic.com/silk-road-members/ 
The Chamber takes active participation in a number of Intergovernmental Trade and Economic Commissions with foreign countries, including China.                                https://armcci.am/pages/historical_overview"
AM.answerer: Answered by Artak Kyurumyan, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AZ.evidence:
The Azerbaijan Republic Chamber of Commerce and Industry is listed as a member of silk road chamber of International Commerce
https://srcic.org/silk-road-members/?page=3
AZ.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

KZ.evidence:
In September 2013, Xi Jinping launched the first half of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) – the “Silk Road Economic Belt” (SREB) – in Kazakhstan. Drawing on the historical legacy of the ancient Silk Roads, the SREB aims to renew cross-continental trade between China and Europe as a driver of growth and connectivity. For more information, visit: https://www.bertelsmann-stiftung.de/en/our-projects/germany-and-asia/news/asia-policy-brief-chinas-footprint-in-central-asia.

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Kazakhstan "Silk Road" is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. For more details, visit: http://www.srcic.com/silk-road-members/
KZ.answerer: Answered by Danil Bekturganov and Tatyana Sedova, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

UZ.evidence:
The participation of Uzbek companies is not listed on the following websites:
https://srcic.org/silk-road-members/?page=1
https://www.bricaistanbul.com/overview/brica-members/
https://www.beltandroadglobalforum.com/en/member/forumfull
UZ.answerer: Answered by Farkhod Tolipov, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

TJ.evidence: The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Tajikistan is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce.
TJ.answerer: Answered by Umedjon Majidi, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

KG.note:
With support from the Kyrgyzstan government for promoting collaboration between the Silk Road Economic Belt and the Eurasian Economic Union, the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce (SRCIC), the Eurasian Economic Union (EEU) Business Council, and the Kyrgyz Union of Manufacturers and Entrepreneurs (KSPP) will jointly hold the Cooperation and Development Forum of the Silk Road Economic Belt in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, on April 25, 2017. The forum will focus on construction collaboration between the Silk Road Economic Belt and the Eurasian Economic Union. Topics will include connectivity and interaction between Europe and Asia, the impact of the Belt and Road Initiative on related countries in infrastructure, investment, and exporting, and the supporting mechanisms for financing, logistics, and business corridors.

http://www.srcic.com/news/cooperation-and-development-forum-of-silk-road-economic-belt/
KG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

JO.evidence: Jordan Chamber of Commerce is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce http://www.srcic.com/silk-road-members/?page=2
JO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

EG.evidence: Federation of Egyptian Chambers of Commerce (FEDCOC) is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce http://www.srcic.com/silk-road-members/?page=1
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

LB.evidence:
The Federation of Chambers of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture in Lebanon (FCCIAL) is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. Also, the Union of Arab Chambers (UAC) is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce http://www.srcic.com/silk-road-members/?page=3 
“Tripoli Municipalities Union is a member of China's Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce (SRCIC). SRCIC Chairman Adnan al Kassar said that the SRCIC is willing to lend Lebanon $2 billion at reasonable interest rates, according to Lebanese-Chinese relations.” 
https://atalayar.com/en/content/chinese-geo-strategic-expansion-levant-case-study-lebanon 
In 2017, prominent Lebanese and Chinese business groups signed in Lebanon two memorandums of understanding to boost the BRI, establishing a Business Council for the Silk Road. 
https://www.iflr.com/article/b1lp1vm14sf28n/chinese-outbound-investment-guide-2018-lebanon 
http://english.scio.gov.cn/2017-11/27/content_41948600.htm
2017 - The Union of Lebanon's Tripoli Municipalities signed an agreement with China's Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce (SRCIC) on Saturday to join the SRCIC for an active role in the Belt and Road Initiative.
LB.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

https://www.bricaistanbul.com/overview/brica-members/"
BY.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

RS.evidence: Serbian Chamber of Commerce is listed as a member on the official web page of Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

GR.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.

MK.evidence: The Macedonian Chamber of Commerce, MCC, and the Economic Chamber of Macedonia are members of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. Therefore, this indicator deserves a “Yes” response.

TR.evidence: Turkey’s largest business association, the Turkish Industry and Business Association (TÜSİAD) is a member of the Belt and Road Industrial and Commercial Alliance (BRICA). The Union of Chambers and Commodity Exchanges of Turkey is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce and its president Rifar Hisarciklioglu is the honorary president of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
TR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

IS.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
IS.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PT.evidence: The Portugal – Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHKCCI) is a member of the Belt and Road Global Forum. While it could be debated whether this is a major business or not, it is formally integrated into the Belt and Road. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PT.note: In Portugal, there are several business associations that deal with trade relations with China such as Luso-Chinese Chamber of Industry and Commerce and the Portugal-China Young Entrepreneus Association, but none are specifically integrated into the Belt and Road Initiative.
PT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RO.evidence: The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Romania (CCIR) is a member of the Belt & Road Industrial and Commercial Alliance (BRICA). However CCIR is not a very credible institution among the local businesses, most of which, especially foreign owned, have nothing to do with it. There is no Romanian business or chamber in the Silk Road Members listed on the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce (SRCIC) website. Here the scoring should be probably more nuanced, somewhere between 0 and 4; a score of 2 would be appropriate
RO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

MD.evidence: We could not find information about individual businesses. Thw Moldovan Chamber of Commerce and Industry is a member of the Silk Road Chamber of Industry and Commerce, while Moldova also has a bilateral Moldova-China Chamber of Commerce and Industry, which includes several well-known local companies and became quite active and visible lately, organising events, but with no clear impact
MD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

IT.evidence: The meaning of major businesses is debatable, but there seems to be no mention of companies of note that are members in these Commercial associations, even less so now that Italy is withdrawing from the Belt and Road initiative.
IT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

NL.evidence: The meaning of major businesses is debatable, but there seems to be no mention of companies of note that are members in these Commercial associations. The only identifiable exception is the Netherlands Council for Trade Promotion, which is a BRICA member, though it is by no means a major business or even an active agent in the country.
NL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

UA.evidence: The Ukrainian Chamber of Commerce and Industry is member of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce.
UA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

AF.evidence: China, Pakistan, and Afghanistan have agreed to extend the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor to Afghanistan. This extension aims to harness Afghanistan's potential as a hub for regional connectivity and is part of the broader Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) efforts to enhance infrastructure and economic ties in the region. The SRCIC, associated with the Belt and Road Initiative, includes Afghanistan among its members.
AF.answerer: Answered by Rahimullah Kakar, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

US.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.

DE.evidence: Germany was one of the 20 countries that joint the Belt and Road Industrial and Commercial Alliance in 2016.

GB.evidence: Based on the available information, it doesn't appear there are major UK businesses substantially involved in these organisations.

AU.evidence:
The International Chamber of Commerce Australia (ICC Australia) is a correspondent of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. There is no publicly evidence of any Australian businesses or organisation being part of the other two organisations named.

It can also be found that several Australian members are listed on the website of the Belt and Road Chinese Chamber Organization Collaboration Network (“一带一路”华商组织协作网). The members include major Chinese business confederations and diaspora organisations, whose events have been attended by representatives of businesses, such as JQZ, a major property developer, and Kong's Holdings, a major pet equipment wholesale and distribution company. It is unknown whether these businesses are members of the target organisations in the Indicator.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: Only one non-major business was mentioned: the International Chamber of Commerce Israel (ICC Israel), as part of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. This business is not widely known.
evidence_urls: https://www.srcic.org/silk-road-members/?page=2Only one non-major business was mentioned: the International Chamber of Commerce Israel (ICC Israel), as part of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce. This business is not widely known.
IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
